body.name: The Mystery of the Haunted House (Sycamore Street Mysteries)
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by ZBK Books.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews Review "A perfect elementary read." -School librarian, Amazon reviews From the Author Follow along with brothers Josh and Noah and their friend Olivia as the three kids discover and solve mysteries in their own neighborhood! These short, illustrated chapter book mysteries for elementary school readers combine adventure and high-tech gear with research and pure nerve. The series showcases friends and siblings working together with good attitudes, clean language, and teamwork. The danger and action are matched by the intelligence, bravery and loyalty of the characters.

body.description: Beware the Haunted House on Sycamore Street!Noah just wants some peace and quiet to finish his homework. But his little brother Josh can’t stop talking about the Haunted House. When they go to check it out, the brothers find out they are not the only kids on the case.Olivia is new in town. But she already has a high tech plan to spy on the Haunted House. The three kids join forces to find out the truth. But when Josh goes missing, Noah and Olivia have to decide which is worse- the risk of the Haunted House, or the risk of losing Josh!Check out all six Sycamore Street Mysteries, illustrated chapter books for elementary readers from author Willow Night! Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Gift for grandson

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 8 year old loves!
reviews.reviewText: My 8 year old finished this book in 3 days. He loved it so much! He’s always been an impressive reader and ahead of the curve, but wow did he love this! He typically loves graphic novels like dog man and cat kid, or captain underpants, but wow this was a hit! Checking out other books by this author after this.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Approved by 8 year old girl
reviews.reviewText: My daughter who always prefers watching TV over books fell in love with this book. She reads it whenever she can. I already ordered next books in this series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2022
reviews.reviewText: My grandson age 8 LOVED THIS BOOK.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: As a mom seeking a fun, thrilling chapter book both my son and I could read together, and after reading a few reviews this seemed fun. I rarely write reviews but this book is pretty terrible. There is no real mystery, it's just a lot of back and forth and ends with the most unexciting summary. Huge buzzkill. We didn't even want to finish it because nothing happened! If you're going to write a mystery book, stir up an interesting story. This was canned, basic, and a true waste of time-- wish I had a review like this so we didn't get it to begin with.
